question: 45th Amendment Bill has extended reservation of seats for Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes in Parliament and State Assemblies up to how many years?
explanation: The Forty-fifth Amendment of the Constitution of India extended the period of reservation of seats for the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes and representation of the Anglo-Indians in the Lok Sabha and the State Legislative Assemblies for another ten years, i.e. up to 1990. The period of reservation was extended to 2000, 2010 and 2020 by the 62nd, 79th and 95th Amendments respectively.
